se.lypson.common.gui.graphics
Class TextField

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.RectangularComponent
      se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.TextField

public class TextField
extends RectangularComponent

A class for drawing a single line text field. Given key presses, the class can also build up the string of the textfield.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Constructor Detail

TextField

public TextField()
Creates a new instance of TextField. The width and height are set to their prefered values.

TextField

public TextField(javax.microedition.lcdui.Display display)
Creates a new instance of TextField. The width and height are set to their prefered values.

Parameters:
display - the display used to retrieve default colors, or null.

TextField

public TextField(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width)
Creates a new instance of TextField. The height is set to the prefered height.

Parameters:
x - the position of the textfields left side.
y - the position of the textfields top side.
width - the width of the textfield.

                 int y,

y - the position of the textfields top side.
width - the width of the textfield.
height - the height of the textfield.

Method Detail

getPreferedWidth

public int getPreferedWidth()
Gets the prefered width of the textfield. The prefered width is the width that allows the text of the textfield to be displayed fully, with space left for padding.

Returns:
The prefered width of the listbox.

getPreferedHeight

public int getPreferedHeight()
Gets the prefered height of the listbox. The prefered height is the height that allows a single line of text to be displayed, with space left for padding.

Returns:
The prefered height of the listbox.

draw

public void draw(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics graphics,
                 boolean highlighted)
Draws the textfield.

Specified by:
draw in class RectangularComponent
Parameters:
graphics - the Graphics instance to draw the textfield with.
highlighted - true to draw the textfield in a highlighted state, using highlighted colors; false to draw the textfield in a neutral state.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Gets the text of the textfield.

Returns:
The text of the textfield.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
Sets the text of the textfield and raises the text changed event.

Parameters:
text - the new text of the textfield.

getFont

public javax.microedition.lcdui.Font getFont()
Gets the font used to draw the text of the textfield.

Returns:
The font used to draw the text of the textfield.

setFont

public void setFont(javax.microedition.lcdui.Font font)
Sets the font used to draw the text of the textfield. After changing the font, it might be neccessary to recalculate the size of the textfield and repaint the text field.

Parameters:
font - the new font to use to draw the text of the textfield.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int keyCode)
Handler for the key pressed event. The pressed key might result in changes to the textfield text, thereby raising the text changed event.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code for the pressed key.

addTextChangedObserver

public void addTextChangedObserver(ITextChangedObserver observer)
Adds a new observer that will be notified when the text changes.

Parameters:
observer - the new observer

removeTextChangedObserver

public void removeTextChangedObserver(ITextChangedObserver observer)
Removes an observer from the list of observers to be notified when the text changes.

Parameters:
observer - the observer to remove.
